definition: to give unequal emphasis to/doing some things at the expense of others
to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
variant of 廢|废[fei4]/disabled

sentences.english: The literary and art works that can last forever all give equal emphasis to emotion and meaning with each supporting the other.
sentences.chinese: 中外传世经典文学艺术作品都是情意互证两不偏废的。

sentences.english: Therefore, learning and reflection should be integrated and neither should be overemphasized.
sentences.chinese: 因此，学思应当有机结合，不可偏废。

sentences.english: Chengchi paid attention to commerce as well as agriculture, especially water conservancy and flood prevention projects.
sentences.chinese: 陈炽注重商业而不偏废农政，对水利河防尤为关注。

sentences.english: No one can ignore the great history achievements of Qian…
sentences.chinese: 钱氏史学贡献甚大，治史者莫可偏废。

sentences.english: Equal emphasis should be placed on collective leadership and individual responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 集体领导和个人负责，二者不可偏废。

sentences.english: In other words, you have to have both. Product and promotion.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，你必须两手都要抓，产品和促销不可偏废。

definition: to run in parallel without hindrance/not mutually exclusive/two processes can be implemented without conflict
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
same as 總而言之|总而言之[zong3 er2 yan2 zhi1]
intellectual development
to stress/to emphasize/particular about sth/to strive for
careless/any-old-how, regardless of the specific task
pinyin: mei2 mao5 hu2 zi5 yi1 ba3 zhua1

definition: to stick to sth stubbornly/never let go
biased/partial
to demand perfection (idiom)
to remedy defects and correct errors (idiom); to rectify past mistakes
to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on preference between advisers rather than the merits of the case
to investigate/dialectical
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
to advance or retreat, each has its rules (idiom from Zhuangzi); many translations are possible
to lay equal stress on/to pay equal attention to
lit. not eating for fear of choking (idiom); fig. to cut off one's nose to spite one's face/to avoid sth essential because of a slight risk
